intro: Bupleurum jucundum, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or meadows. Bupleurum jucundum is valued for its aromatic foliage and historical use in herbal medicine.
